de.japi.components

Class Japi2Meter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • de.japi.components.AbstractDrawable
            • de.japi.components.AbstractJapi2ValueComponent
              • de.japi.components.Japi2Meter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable

    public class Japi2Meter
extends AbstractJapi2ValueComponent
    This is a SWING component to provide a gauge meter GUI component which is controlled by a single value (sets the pointer).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Japi2Meter

        public Japi2Meter(java.lang.String title)
        Constructs a new gauge meter. If optimized rendering is enabled the background is painted lighter than the normal panel background (see AbstractJapi2ValueComponent.isOptimizationEnabled()).
        Parameters:
        title - the title to display, not null.

    • Method Detail

      • getDangerValue

        public int getDangerValue()
        Returns the danger value. The zone between dangerValue and max is considered as danger zone. If value gets into this zone the pointer gets red. Also this zone is marked red on the scale.
        Returns:
        lower bound of the dangerous zone.

      • setDangerValue

        public void setDangerValue(int dangerValue)
        Sets the danger zone. See getDangerValue() for information.
        Parameters:
        dangerValue - lower bound of the dangerous zone.

      • setTitle

        public final void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Sets the title to display on the gauge meter.
        Parameters:
        title - the title to display, not null.

      • setValue

        public void setValue(int value)
        Description copied from class: AbstractJapi2ValueComponent
        Sets the current value of this component.
        Overrides:
        setValue in class AbstractJapi2ValueComponent
        Parameters:
        value - the value for this component. If the given value is not in the interval [min, max], the lower or upper bound will be set instead.
